item.title: Liz add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Liz add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "I would be most content if my children grew up to be the kind of people who think decorating consists mostly of building enough bookshelves." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Liz add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Liz add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Liz add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Liz add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Liz add a quote by Joseph Joubert
item.description: "The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones." -- Joseph Joubert

item.title: Liz add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Liz add a quote by Garrison Keillor
item.description: "Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car." -- Garrison Keillor

item.title: Liz add a quote by Mary Bly
item.description: "Dogs come when they're called; cats take a message and get back to you later." -- Mary Bly

item.title: Liz add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: Liz add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook

item.title: Liz add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Liz add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Liz add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Liz add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Liz add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Liz add a quote by August Strindberg
item.description: "Life is not so idiotically mathematical that only the big eat the small; it is just as common for a bee to kill a lion or at least to drive it mad." -- August Strindberg

item.title: Liz add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Everybody is identical in their secret unspoken belief that way deep down they are different from everyone else." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Liz add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "Do not go gentle into that good night. Rage, rage against the dying of the light." -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Liz add a quote by B. F. Skinner
item.description: "We shouldn't teach great books; we should teach a love of reading. Knowing the contents of a few works of literature is a trivial achievement. Being inclined to go on reading is a great achievement." -- B. F. Skinner

item.title: Liz add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Liz add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Do your thing and don't care if they like it." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Liz add a quote by O. Henry
item.description: "Each of us, when our day's work is done, must seek our ideal, whether it be love or pinochle or lobster à la Newburg, or the sweet silence of the musty bookshelves." -- O. Henry

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jorge Amado
item.description: "The world is like that -- incomprehensible and full of surprises ." -- Jorge Amado

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "To the people who are upset about their hard-earned tax money going to things they don’t like: welcome to the f*cking club. Reimburse me for the Iraq war and oil subsidies, and diaphragms are on me!" -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley

item.title: Liz add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Liz add a quote by Anne Tyler
item.description: "I read so I can live more than one life in more than one place." -- Anne Tyler

item.title: Liz add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there." -- Will Rogers
